Class Picture

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimplePicture
      • Picture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DigitalPicture

    public class Picture
extends SimplePicture
    Represents a picture. This class inherits from SimplePicture and allows the student to add functionality to the Picture class.
    Author:
    Barbara Ericson ericson@cc.gatech.edu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Picture()
      Default constructor.
      Picture(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
      Constructor that takes a buffered image.
      Picture(int height, int width)
      Constructor that takes the width and height.
      Picture(Picture copyPicture)
      Constructor that takes a picture and creates a copy of that picture.
      Picture(java.lang.String fileName)
      Constructor that takes a file name and creates the picture.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void change1()
      Method to _________________________________
      void change2()
      Method to _________________________________
      void copy(Picture fromPic, int startRow, int startCol)
      Copies from the passed fromPic to the specified startRow and startCol in the current picture.
      void createCollage()
      Creates a collage of several pictures.
      void fixUnderwater()
      Enhances the pixels that are the least like water.
      void grayscale()
      Sets all red, green, and blue values of each pixel to the average of the current values.
      void keepOnlyBlue()
      Sets the red and green values of each pixel to 0.
      void mirrorArms()
      Mirrors just part of a picture of a snowman.
      void mirrorDiagonal()
      Mirrors the picture around a diagonal mirror starting in the upper-left corner and continuing at a 45-degree angle.
      void mirrorHorizontalBottomToTop()
      Mirrors the picture around a horizontal mirror in the center of the picture from bottom to top.
      void mirrorHorizontalTopToBottom()
      Mirrors the picture around a horizontal mirror in the center of the picture from top to bottom.
      void mirrorSwan()
      Mirrors just part of a picture of a swan.
      void mirrorTemple()
      Mirrors just part of a picture of a temple.
      void mirrorVerticalLeftToRight()
      Mirrors the picture around a vertical mirror in the center of the picture from left to right.
      void mirrorVerticalRightToLeft()
      Mirrors the picture around a vertical mirror in the center of the picture from right to left.
      void negate()
      Sets all red, green, and blue values of each pixel to 255 - current value.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string with information about this picture.
      void zeroBlue()
      Sets the blue to 0.

      • Picture

        public Picture()
        Default constructor. Not needed but shows students the implicit call to super(). Child constructors always call a parent constructor.

      • Picture

        public Picture(java.lang.String fileName)
        Constructor that takes a file name and creates the picture.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file to create the picture from

               int width)
        Constructor that takes the width and height.
        Parameters:
        height - the height of the desired picture
        width - the width of the desired picture

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public void copy(Picture fromPic,
                 int startRow,
                 int startCol)
        Copies from the passed fromPic to the specified startRow and startCol in the current picture.
        Parameters:
        fromPic - the picture to copy from
        startRow - the start row to copy to
        startCol - the start col to copy to
